discussion.content: It doesnt mention that the users have Dynamics 365 for Outlook setup/in use so going by the question only, it seems that only A would be correct.

comments.content: I understand your point but it has asked for two possible ways so A & B are the best answers.

questions.question_text:
You have an environment that includes Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Exchange Online.
Email messages between Microsoft Dynamics and Exchange are synchronizing correctly.
You need to ensure that appointments, contacts, and tasks are synchronized.
What are two possible ways to achieve this goal? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

choices.B: Configure the default synchronization method for appointments, contacts, and tasks to use Microsoft Dynamics 365 for outlook.
choices.A: Configure the default synchronization method for appointments, contacts, and tasks to use server side synchronization.
choices.C: Connect Microsoft Dynamics 365 to POP3/SMTP servers.

questions.question_text: Which component can you add to a solution?

choices.C: Create a self-referential relationship and configure hierarchy settings.
choices.D: Set up a N:N relationship between Accounts and Equipment.
choices.A: Ensure that you enable Connections for the entity.
choices.B: Set up a parental 1:N relationship between Accounts and Equipment.

discussion.content: Should be C. Nothing in the question mentions accounts
I agree with everyone else. I'll be choosing C when I take the exam.
Totally Agree. This is C. Self Referential and Hiearchy settings are the controls available to implement such functionality

questions.question_text:
Your company rents tools and machines to customers.
You create a custom entity named Equipment to track the tools and machines.
You need to show the hierarchical relationships between various pieces of equipment.
How should you configure the relationship?

discussion.content: Themes cannot be 'exported' as part of solution. It should be C and D
I'll be choosing C and D when I take the exam.
B is wrong. It is part of configuration. Should be C and D

questions.question_text: Which two components can you export as part of a solution? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

discussion.content: Answer should be Organization which is A. Others are not access levels.
should be A, why are there so many mistakes in those answers provided? who's the so-called expert that provide the answers?

Global allows access to all of an organizationâ€™s records.
 Deep allows access to all records in their business unit and in subordinate units.
 Local allows access to all records in their business unit.
 Basic allows access to records they own or that are shared with them or their teams.
 None allows no access to records.
I'll be choosing A when I take the exam.

questions.question_text:
You need to grant users the ability to read all accounts in Microsoft Dynamics 365.
Which access level should you apply to the Read permission for the Account entity?
